section: In the event that the parties are unable to agree to an SOW within 2 months following the Effective Date, either party may, in its sole discretion, terminate this Agreement by providing written notice. Once approved, the parties shall use commercially reasonable efforts to diligently implement their respective obligations under the SOW. Upon completion of its duties under the SOW, a party shall notify the other party and provide the other party with the opportunity to test and evaluate its work. i-Escrow shall make available the Shadow Site for such testing in a timely manner. Each party shall reasonably cooperate with the other party in effectuating their respective duties under the SOW. The Information Transfer Mechanism shall not go live until its operation has been approved ("Approval Date") by both parties, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld.
explanation: This section discusses the SOW and the development of the Information Transfer Mechanism. However, it lacks specific details on the criteria for 'unreasonably withheld' approval. This ambiguity can lead to disputes if one party claims the other is delaying approval without a valid reason. The absence of clear benchmarks for acceptable reasons to withhold approval introduces uncertainty and potential for conflict, undermining the contract's enforceability.

section: 8.1 TERM. The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: There is an inconsistency in the renewal terms. It states that the agreement renews for successive one-year terms by mutual written agreement. However, it further says if notice isn't given 30 days before expiration, it *automatically* renews. This creates a contradiction, as it could automatically renew without mutual written agreement. These are conflicting requirements for renewal, leading to uncertainty.

section: Except as otherwise provided, if performance hereunder (other than payment) is prevented, restricted or interfered with by any act or condition whatsoever beyond the reasonable control of a party (a "force majeure event"), the party so affected, upon giving prompt notice to the other party, shall be excused from such performance to the extent of such prevention, restriction or interference. However, if a force majeure event interferes with the operation of this Agreement for sixty (60) days or more, either party can terminate this Agreement, without penalty. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the occurrence of any force majeure event shall not limit either party's obligations under Section 9 with respect to any third party claim as to which the other party seeks indemnification.
explanation: This section describes Force Majeure. The clause regarding the indemnity obligations under Section 9 is confusing and potentially contradictory. While the Force Majeure clause excuses performance, it says it doesn't limit obligations under Section 9 (Indemnity). This creates ambiguity, because a Force Majeure event might directly cause a claim for which indemnification is sought. The exception essentially negates the protection of the Force Majeure in certain scenarios, creating a potential contradiction.
